name: Prehistoric Honey Badger
resistance: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The prehistoric honey badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the badger takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The prehistoric honey badger makes one bite attack and one crunch attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 15).

actions.name: Crunch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one grappled creature. Hit: The target suffers from broken bones and must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns. On a failed saving throw, the target cannot take any actions or reactions during that turn. If the target receives magical healing or takes a long rest, the effect ends.
